Description: Marl pottery jar with flat base and conical sides becoming convex at the shoulder at which there are two long debased pie crust handles making almost a continuous band; with inset neck and everted out-turned rim; bag of soil deposits within.
Curator's comments: Marked R1 on the side. Most like Wavy handle ware W60A in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
